intro: Achillea elegans, commonly known as the slender yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its historical use in herbal medicine is attributed to its purported ability to promote wound healing and reduce inflammation.
